reviews.review:
This game is called Portal 2. It's Portal, but with a 2. Therefore it is good and better. Buy it now. Before now. Before it was even announced. Buy it then.

Note:
This game contains references to ROBOT HATS. If ROBOT HATS have been known to cause nausea, night terrors, suspense of disbelief, referring to ROBOT HATS as ROBOT HATS, or other ROBOT HATS, suspend ROBOT HATS activity until further ROBOT HATS can be ROBOT HATS.

A truly spectacular game, was well worth the long grind during the weekend on april 15th. It adds so much to what made the first game a cult hit whilst still keeping the original feel of the first, which is very rare to see in sequels (well... not valves XD). It has great characters, acting and storyline that will keep you captivated till the very last test chamber. The ending will have you in awe and in stitches at the same time. The story itself was way unexpected to the scale it was especially since the first had very minor story but this one is jampacked with backstory meaty goodness, which is what I like a lot... if you do too... then Portal 2 is for you!
Awsomesauce!
One of Valve's best. Worth every penny.

La mejor campaña "Made in Valve" y el cooperativo más divertido y trabajado que puedas encontrar hasta la fecha.

Un apartado técnico increible pese a seguir utilizando el motor Source, una diversión y un humor desternillante y la firma de valve sobre todo el producto hace que te enamores de este shooter con los mejores puzzles que recuerdo en muchos lustros.
Its like Portal 1, but better, and longer, and more fun, and more joy inducing.

If it's not already obvious this follows for the classic Portal and like portal this didn't fail to impress, valve truly went all out. Again this is a great puzzle game both single and multiplayer. Honestly I didn't expect the multiplayer to be... well any good. But gladly to my surprised it was, only thing I'm not too intent on is the backpack and items, seems rather pointless but otherwise I highly recommend this game!

Definitely a good game and worth preordering. Playtime of the single-player campaign is about seven and a half hours, depending on whether you get stuck a few times in some of the later chambers. For the achievement hunters out there, it's unlikely that you'll get more than 14 of the 50 acheivements without a lot of watching where you are and what you are doing.

I have not yet played the co-operative campaign, but I plan on doing so soon.
ilk portal oyununu alın 10 ile çarpın. mükemmel bir oyun.

Just finished this most epic sequel and I have to say its a masterpiece, once again Valve have done it again, hilarious, ingenius, hard but doable which just makes everyone feel good.
The game is a sequel yet feels so fresh, its still portal but you would hardly know it, there isn't a single thing reused (unless story related)  new jokes that are funnier, new chambers that are somehow even more ingenius and fun.
Its brilliant and no-one can call themselves a gamer unitl they have played these two. Many props to Valve! Now get us HL 2 Ep3!! :D
Holy crap this game is amazing. 11/10. get it.

PUZZLES THAT TEST YOUR BRAIN? YES!
WITTY HUMOUR? YES!
PRETTY ART? YES!
CRAZY POWER HUNGRY ROBOT AI? YES!
MULTIPLAYER COOP? YES!
STEAM WORKSHOP SUPPORT? YES!
VALVE? YES!
GABEN? YES!
Seriously... just buy it.

Never before have I played a game that was this funny. The original portal was a surprise - the little game packed with the orange box that turned out to be the star attraction. Portal 1 was an amazing game. Even so, It is hard to imagine a way in which portal 2 does not surprass the original. The humor is more dense and sophisticated (not in a pretentious way, but rather in the sense that the original's humor was derived almost entirely from GlaDOS. The story is larger in scope, the mythology is expanded (if you're into that sort of thing) and the gameplay- wow! With an armful of new twists on the formula, and puzzles that can be far larger in scope than in the original - look If it sounds like I'm gushing, it's because I absolutely love this game. If you're at all interested, get it. You will not regret the decision.

Far better than the original. Mega Smooth, Mega Fun, Highly Recommended ;)

Would love to be playing this for the first time again. Instead, going to play it for about the 10th time very soon. Still love it. Hoping for a Portal 3 some day.
Better than I had hoped, continues to be funny. Game of the year.
Espectacular. No dejéis de probarlo. Un humor alucinante, diseño de niveles, genial y el cooerativo es de lo mejor. Grandes los robots!
Eins der Besten Spiele des Jahres 2011 !

I've been waiting for this game ever since they announced it a year ago. Portal was originally the entire reason I got the orange box and got me into TF2 (which I have over 2000 hours banked on). Portal 2 doesn't disappoint because it looks absolutely amazing, plays perfectly, and has an amazing storyline (although I'd recommend playing Portal before playing this game). Lots of new things to keep it fresh from the original game, and there's a ton of puzzles that will keep you thinking. GAME OF THE YEAR IMO
Just finished the single player... and it was the best single player campaign i have ever played in my entire life. Do not hesitate. Buy this game.

Absolutely amazing! MUCH, MUCH more awesome that Portal 1, and that's saying something.
Get it, if you aren't playing it RIGHT, NOW!

Wow, just played this game for 3 hours straight, haven't touched multiplayer yet, but let me tell you, singleplayer alone is worth the cash for this game. Hell, I had the first Portal beat in 3 hours time...so not only are we looking at a longer game, but a few of the puzzles had me scratching my head as well, especially with the new elements added to the game. All this, and the game runs SMOOTH as can be, and my laptop usually has problems running newer games, not this one...it's as close to perfect as we are gonna get...
Where's the No Russian level?!?!?!
Nice to see what a full-size production budget can do when it's combined with the awesome gameplay we got with Portal 1. A work of art!

Warning: This game may induce pain in abdominal muscles from too much laughter. Make sure you ready 500 mg of Ibuprofen and 120 ml dihydrogen oxide ready before initiating game or suffer the consequences in 3.... 2.... [ERROR 500]!

One of the best games ever made. Funny story. Exceptional voice acting. Great concept.

This game is downright amazing. I could try to describe it but it would be like trying to describe why the world exists. I would have to tell you every single detail, but even then, you wouldnt truly know because you havent experienced it. The story is fantastic and very well developed, The atmosphere is simply incredible, and art style, is the most amazing art style I have ever seen in a video game. It was done so well that you would be a fool not to buy it.

Don't just sit there reading! If you haven't already bought this game, buy it right NOW!!!!

This is my all time favorite game along with Portal.  This has everthing you need and want in a game: Eye candy, fun, physics, lots of laughs, great story.  I honestly could not tell you to not buy this game at all.  I shall go down in the history books as the greatest game ever.  If i ever say this about a game that is not Portal then i will stab my eyes out with a spork.
Buy this game. Don't even think about it, just do it... for science.

7年后的我变了.历经游戏里面商店服务器关闭的很长一段时间.今天上线之后发现商店又可以连了.果断把所有物品都买下来了.

Awesome.  Great sequel, it's been a long time since a game's nemesis has caused me to fear for what's to come like GlaDOS does in Portal 2.  The plot and ending of the first game allow for a very real and large amount of tension and animosity at the beginning of this one that would otherwise be impossible, but the subtlety of the introduction allows you think for a short time that maybe things are going to be OK.  

Five minutes in I was totally hooked, and I haven't even touched the co-op aspect yet.  Not necessary to play the first one first, but I would highly recommend it as it will set the mood in ways a synopsis or overview cannot.  Also as one of the key drawbacks of the original was the brevity of its single player campaign, it can be completed quicker than you would think, and that drawback is now a plus. 

I haven't finished the game, but I have no doubt this is the sequel fans of the original were hoping for, and that it will only get better as I go deeper into the story.
So far, so good.  You know you want it.

Portal 2 is Valve's last great game from its golden age. It's a worthy sequel to [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/trar/recommended/400]the original Portal[/url], which was a short but sweet puzzler with a simple yet innovative central mechanic. This time around it's less of a horror-mystery and more of an action-comedy. There's new mechanics, more puzzles, more areas of Aperture to explore and even more AIs to supply witty (or not-so-witty in the case of the chief new character) banter. That, and a doozy of an ending. It's absolutely worth playing, but I would recommend playing the first Portal beforehand if possible.

A separate co-op campaign - best played with friends, since that's what it was meant for and you won't find strangers looking for a partner anymore - as well as a level maker with Workshop upload capability add to the game's replayability. It's interesting to note that there is a menu option for multiplayer item trading that was ultimately never implemented, which kind of tells you about where Valve would go as a developer. There is also a good 'making-of' [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/trar/recommended/104600]Portal 2 e-book[/url] for sale in the Steam store that I'd recommend as well if you're interested about the game's history.
